messages.message: Curious why the home button in converse takes you to My Hub. I would assume it would take me back to explore since thats the home of aihub.xxx.com (http://aihub.xxx.com), then when you click it in my apps it takes you to explore. Its very confusing and make my demo confusing to the customer
we can change it then -- think we got enough feedback on this

The reason why we've made this change is that as we invest in My Hub it will become the "home" for an experienced user instead of Explore. Explore is intended to only be the starting point for new users only.

Within My Hub a user will be able to search across all conversations, projects and start new conversations and projects.

Out of curiosity, @joshbronko @Lee @Tom do you think renaming it from "Home" to "My Hub" would solve this or is there other user need to go to "Explore" rather than "My Hub" directly that we're missing?

cc: @Siya @Xindi Xu
We should keep the icon consistent. Converse uses a home icon. Build uses a different icon
I think the landing page needs to be consistent from base url to what home resembles.
The icons look the same on sandbox @joshbronko
do you mind sharing a pic if you're seeing something different
Hmm let me share when I get back to my keyboard. Maybe it was in uat
I totally saw something different before but you are correct they are the same icon. not sure which icon i was refering to
Ahhh it was under when you run an app

Yes good catch! We were actually planning to update as follows, where all places said "home" with a home icon. When you pressed "Home" you were always taken to the "home" of that asset:
• Home in converse -> goes to the conversation page of the open workspace in my hub
• Home in build -> goes to the project page of the open workspace in my hub
• Home in a custom app -> goes to app page in the org context
But we can adjust this based on feedback. A few other options:
1. In all places we have "home" with home icon and it takes you to the home of the asset (described above)
    a. Pro: navigates a user to where they most likely need to be
    b. Con: no consistent "home" experience - brings to different pages
2. In all places we have "Home" with home icon which takes you to Explore 
    a. Pro: consistent experience
    b. Con: user can't really do anything at explore and needs several clicks to get back
3. In all places we have "My Hub" with home icon which takes you to My Hub
    a. Pro: consistent experience
    b. Con: doesn't really make sense for apps that no longer live in my hub
4. Build and Converse have "My Hub" with home icon which takes you to My Hub; custom app leads you to "Apps" with different icon
    a. Pro: most descriptive; takes users where they're likely to go
    b. Con: not consistent across build,converse, custom app
With these options and feedback above about Home not being clear, I'd be in favor of option 4. What are your thoughts @joshbronko @Lee @Tom?
so does Home mean My Hub?
It seems in most of these cases that we just send a user to My Hub, aside from the custom apps I suppose. I feel that the Explore/Landing Page isn’t likely to be a highly trafficked page.
@Travis home was going to mean the "home" of that asset in 49, but we've got a lot of user feedback that this is confusing. Options 1-4 above are ways we can proceed.
